meanings.definition: Move from a lower position to a higher one.
meanings.sent1: I rise from my chair to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: The sun will rise in the east tomorrow morning.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to rise slowly, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits began to rise as she achieved her goal.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon's rise into the sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Increase in number, size, amount, or degree.
meanings.sent1: The number of students will rise after the holidays.
meanings.sent2: Prices tend to rise during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The excitement started to rise as the concert drew near.
meanings.sent4: Her voice rose above the noise of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The tide began to rise, covering the sandy beach.

meanings.definition: Get up from lying, sitting, or kneeling.
meanings.sent1: I rise early every morning to start my day.
meanings.sent2: The cat will rise from its nap when it hears the food bowl.
meanings.sent3: He pretended to rise from the dead during the play.
meanings.sent4: The superhero will rise from the ground to save the day.
meanings.sent5: The bread will rise in the oven, creating a delicious smell.

meanings.sent1: The new leader will rise to guide the nation.
meanings.sent2: Her confidence will rise as she gains more experience.
meanings.sent3: The magician will rise to fame with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The hero will rise against all odds to defeat the villain.
meanings.sent5: The sun will rise, casting light over the land.

meanings.sent1: The rise in property values made homeowners happy.
meanings.sent2: Investors hope for a rise in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rise in prices shocked the customers.
meanings.sent4: The rise in demand led to higher prices for the product.
meanings.sent5: The rise in the cost of living affected many families.
